docs.title: PSubsonic
docs.text:
PSubsonic is an experimental PowerShell module for interacting with a Subsonic server. It was initially created as a part of a personal music library re-organization project where I simply needed a way to automate triggering a library scan in Navidrome.

Note: PSubsonic is pronounced "subsonic"

docs.title: Installation
docs.text: Install-Module PSubsonic

docs.title: Connect to your Subsonic server
docs.text:
$address = Read-Host -Prompt 'Subsonic server address'
$credential = Get-Credential
Connect-PSubsonic -Address $address -Credential $credential

docs.title: Start a music library scan
docs.text:
# This will trigger a "quick scan" in Navidrome
Start-PSubScan

# This will trigger a "full scan" in Navidrome and may not have any effect on other apps.
Start-PSubScan -Full

docs.title: Get a list of artists
docs.text: Get-PSubIndex

docs.title: Get a list of tracks that are currently being played
docs.text: Get-PSubNowPlaying

docs.title: TODO
docs.text:
• Write documentation
  • Write integration tests to run against a live Navidrome instance
  • Add support for more Subsonic API methods
  • Explore alternative output formatting for better support for piping or chaining commands together.

docs.title: Change Log
docs.text:
All notable changes to this project will be documented in this file.

The format is based on Keep a Changelog and this project adheres to Semantic Versioning.

docs.title: Changed
docs.text: • Set the minimum PowerShell version to 7.0.
Initial release

docs.title: SYNOPSIS
docs.text: Establishes or updates the module's connection to a Subsonic server and verifies connectivity.

docs.title: SYNTAX
docs.text:
Connect-PSubsonic [[-Address] <Uri>] [[-Credential] <PSCredential>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>]
 [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: DESCRIPTION
docs.text: Authenticates with a Subsonic server using the provided address and credential by calling the "ping.view" method. If successful, the address and credential are stored in memory and reused in other commands in the module.

docs.title: Example 1
docs.text:
$cred = Get-Credential
Connect-PSubsonic -Address https://music.example.local -Credential $cred

Prompt for credentials, and then connect to a fictional Subsonic server.

docs.title: -Address
docs.text:
The fully qualified URI of a Subsonic server, including the HTTP or HTTPS scheme and the port number if not using the default for the provided scheme (80 or 443 respectively).

Type: Uri
Parameter Sets: (All)
Aliases:

Required: False
Position: 0
Default value: None
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: -Credential
docs.text:
The username and password used to authenticate with the Subsonic server.

Type: PSCredential
Parameter Sets: (All)
Aliases:

Required: False
Position: 1
Default value: None
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False
